meanings.definition: To promote or sell goods or services
meanings.sent1: The store merchandised their new products by placing them at the front of the store.
meanings.sent2: She merchandised her handmade jewelry at the craft fair.
meanings.sent3: The magician merchandised his tricks to the audience, making them believe in his magic.
meanings.sent4: The politician merchandised his policies to the voters, hoping to win their support.
meanings.sent5: The chef merchandised his signature dish with a mouth-watering description on the menu.

meanings.definition: The goods or services available for sale in a store or online platform
meanings.sent1: The new merchandised items in the store caught the attention of shoppers.
meanings.sent2: Online platforms offer a wide range of merchandised products for customers to choose from.
meanings.sent3: The toy store had a section dedicated to merchandised items from popular movies.
meanings.sent4: The museum gift shop had a variety of merchandised souvenirs for visitors to purchase.
meanings.sent5: The bookstore displayed a selection of merchandised books near the entrance.
